pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:6.2: At that time a brahmin had invited the nuns for a meal.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:6.3: After the nuns had eaten and expressed their satisfaction, they went to their respective families, where some ate and others got almsfood and left.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:6.4: Soon afterwards that brahmin said this to his neighbors,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:6.5: “The nuns have been satisfied by me. Come, and I’ll satisfy you, too.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:6.8: Those nuns who were invited by you came to our houses, where some ate and others got almsfood and left.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:6.9: That brahmin complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:6.10: “How can they eat in our house and afterwards eat elsewhere? Am I not able to give them as much as they want?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:7.1: The nuns heard the complaints of that brahmin,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:7.3: “How can nuns finish their meal and express their satisfaction, and then eat elsewhere?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that those nuns did that?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:7.7: How can nuns finish their meal and express their satisfaction, and then eat elsewhere?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:8.1: ‘If a nun who has been invited or expressed her satisfaction eats staple or non-staple food, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:10.2: invited to eat any of the five staple foods.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:11.2: eating is seen, staple food is seen, it is offered by one standing within arm’s reach, a refusal is seen.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:12.2: apart from the five staple foods, rice-porridge, the post-midday tonics, the seven-day tonics, and the lifetime tonics—
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:13.2: there are five kinds of staple food: cooked grain, porridge, flour, fish, and meat.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:14.1: If she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:14.2: For every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:15.1: If she has been invited, and she perceives that she has, and she eats staple or non-staple food, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:15.2: If she has been invited, but she is unsure if she has, and she eats staple or non-staple food, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:15.3: If she has been invited, but she does not perceives that she has, and she eats staple or non-staple food, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:16.1: If she receives post-midday tonics, seven-day tonics, or lifetime tonics for the purpose of food, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:16.2: For every mouthful, she commits an offense of wrong conduct. …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:17.7: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc54:18.1: The fourth training rule is finished.
